message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class TestWorker {
    public static void main(String args[]){
        Worker[] worklist = new Worker[5];
        worklist[0] = new Worker("Richard Cooper","s1235",20.0);
        worklist[1] = new Worker("John Major","s1236",18.0);
        worklist[2] = new Worker("Mary Thatcher","s1237",15.0);
        worklist[3] = new Worker("David Benjamin","s1238",16.0);
        worklist[4] = new Worker("Jack Soo","s1239",25.0);

        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
        String inputLine;

        do{
            System.out.println("\n");
            System.out.print("Please Enter ID and hours-worked in a given week: ");
            inputLine = input.nextLine();
            StringTokenizer stringTokenizer = new StringTokenizer(inputLine,"+");

            if(stringTokenizer.countTokens() == 2){
                String workerID = stringTokenizer.nextToken();
                double hoursWorked = Double.parseDouble(stringTokenizer.nextToken());

                boolean workerFound = false;
                for(Worker worker : worklist){
                    if(worker.getWorkerID().equals(workerID)){
                        worker.addWeekly(hoursWorked);
                        worker.gross();
                        worker.displaySalary();
                        workerFound = true;
                        break;
                    }
                }

                if(!workerFound){
                    System.out.println("Worker with ID: " + workerID + " not found.");
                }
            }else{
                System.out.println("Please Enter correct information");
            }
        }while(!inputLine.isEmpty());
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken API is used to break the input string into tokens. In the given code, the input string is expected to be in the format "workerID+hoursWorked". The StringTokenizer breaks this string into two tokens - workerID and hoursWorked. These tokens are then used to find the worker in the array and update their weekly hours. If the worker is not found in the array, an error message is displayed. The loop continues until the user enters an empty string.
